alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 10:10PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Wayne and southwestern Pulaski Counties through 1045 PM EDT... At 1009 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cains Store, or 11 miles south of Liberty, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Cains Store and Magnum around 1015 PM EDT. Pointer, Faubush and Stab around 1020 PM EDT. Nancy, Hogue and Naomi around 1025 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Pulaski County Park, Somerset, Burnside, Somerset Pulaski Airport, Elihu, Bronston, Quinton, Ruth, General Burnside S.P., Tateville and Sloans Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for south central Kentucky.
